title: 15  EDS Opps, Orgs & More
section: 15.1 EDS Programs, Opportunities, Organizations and More
text: 15.1 EDS Programs, Opportunities, Organizations and More

title: 15  EDS Opps, Orgs & More
text:
15.2 Column Definitions
EDS opportunities are classified into one of the following types:








Type
Definition




Academia
eds organization affliated with universities, colleges, research labs


Government
eds program, opportunity or organization affiliated with a state or federal government agency


Independent
eds program, opportunity or organization that was independently created by an individual or group that is neither a business or a non-profit


Masters Program
eds opportunities with a formal degree program at a college or university


Non-profit
eds organization that is mission-driven and a non-business entity




The additional columns are defined as follows:








Column
Definition




Name
name of opportunity, organization or program


Affiliation
if applicable, name of parent organization, group, school, etc that the organization or program is affiliated with


Offering
type or name of eds opportunity being offered by the organization or program


Description
a very brief description of the eds opportunity


Twitter Handle
twitter username




There are columns in the other-eds-opportunities sheet not listed here because they are not shown in this table, but definitions for those columns can be found in the tab definitions in the sheet.

title: 16  Conferences
text:
Conferences, events, and more that NCEAS staff have attended to lead a workshop or talk related to Learning Hub curriculum.











Event Name
Date of Event
Workshop or Talk Name
Brief Description
NCEAS Staff
Link to materials





Aug 2021
Managing Ecological Data for Effective Use and Re-Use
Learn to organize and share your data through all parts of the research cycle. Topics include data organization, data documentation, and the importance of good data management practices for data sharing, collaboration, and data re-use.
Jeanette Clark; Amber Budden; Matthew Jones

title: 3  Arctic Data Center
text:
3.1 Scalable Computing

3.1.1 Remote Computing
Section type: Technical
Estimated length of section: 1 h
General Objectives:

Understand the basic architecture of computer networks
Learn how to connect to a remote computer via a shell
Become familiarized with Bash Shell programming to navigate your computer’s file system, manipulate files and directories, and automate processes

Notes:

Camila:
Halina:



3.1.2 Python Programming on Clusters
Section type: Technical
Estimated length of section: 1.5 h
General Objectives:

Basic Python review
Using virtual environments
Writing in Jupyter notebooks
Writing functions in Python

Notes:

Camila: This is an introduction to Python module
Halina:
